meanings.definition: To complain or argue about something.
meanings.sent1: She keeps beefing about her homework.
meanings.sent2: They were beefing over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: Why are you beefing about the weather? It won't change!
meanings.sent4: The siblings were beefing like cats and dogs over the TV remote.
meanings.sent5: His constant beefing made everyone avoid him.

meanings.definition: To add strength or substance to something.
meanings.sent1: He is beefing up his muscles by lifting weights.
meanings.sent2: Adding more spices will beef up the flavor of the soup.
meanings.sent3: I'm beefing up this essay with extra examples.
meanings.sent4: The new evidence beefed up their case significantly.
meanings.sent5: The team needs to beef up their defense for the next game.

meanings.definition: To engage in a physical fight or confrontation.
meanings.sent1: The two wrestlers were beefing in the ring.
meanings.sent2: The gangs were beefing over territory.
meanings.sent3: Imagine two sumo wrestlers beefing over the last donut!
meanings.sent4: The knights were beefing with the dragons in the epic battle.
meanings.sent5: The superheroes were beefing against the supervillains to save the city.
